abstract: Onetime members of Second Battalion, Seventh Marine Regiment, alarmed by high number of suicides in their ranks and frustrated with inadequate response of government agencies, have formed their own team for tracking and responding to veterans' mental health; team, fueled by social media and shared experience, has had some success in stemming deaths among men hit hard by their experience in Afghanistan.
lead_paragraph: Members of a Marine battalion that served in a restive region in Afghanistan have been devastated by the deaths of comrades and frustrated by the V.A.

headline.main: In Unit Stalked by Suicide, Veterans Try to Save One Another
headline.print_headline: A Unit Stalked by Suicide, Trying to Save Itself

snippet: Members of a Marine battalion that served in a restive region in Afghanistan have been devastated by the deaths of comrades and frustrated by the V.A.
